page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The block, mainly open country,includes Filkins, a village of 300, and touches the village of Eastleach. It straddles the Oxon-Glos boundary and is crossed by the A361 between Burford and Lech- lade. The block covers the old parish of Filkins which lies on the first rise of the Cotswolds from the Thames Valley, just to the north of the golden corridor of thriving industry that runs from London to Bristol. Three miles to the east is RAF Brize Norton. Fast-growing Swindon, l5 miles to the south, exerts increasing influence. Local government offices and hospitals are in Oxford and Witney. The needs of Filkins as a Cotswold village (conservation & tourism) are not as well understood by Oxon CC as are those of Eastleach by Glos CC. Both villages have lost their schools and neither has complete main drainage.
